channel.title: Decompile .exe, is it possible?
channel.description: Hello, I've started to read some C++ guides and have searched for small games etc. which I could learn from if I had the source code, but none of the games come with the source code so I would need to decompile them. I googled this, but all I found was that compiled C++ is impossible to decompile because the compiling process has nothing to do with the language but I still keep trying. If anyone has any ideas how to decompile them, help would be very much appreciated. :)

item.title: Decompile .exe, is it possible?
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

You can disassemble it and peice together what is happening.
However,

1: C++ sometimes compiles into very hard to follow machine code, especially if the compiler tried to optimize it
2: You will have little chance of reconstructing any structures/classes.

Read full topic

item.title: Decompile .exe, is it possible?
item.dc:creator: @Heaven Heaven
item.description:
@Heaven wrote:

Supposdley xerocheez told me that he could do this, (like a year ago lol.)

Read full topic

item.title: Decompile .exe, is it possible?
item.dc:creator: @dev_eXer dev eXer
item.description:
@dev_eXer wrote:

You can’t retain the c++ source code. It will just display ASM. It is possible to reverse ASM into C++ assuming it is a game it would take 2-3 years.

Read full topic

item.title: Decompile .exe, is it possible?
item.dc:creator: @jensie jensie
item.description:
@jensie wrote:

[quote=“nade, post:7, topic:119139”]Why don’t you read a book? Everything that can be made in c++ is probably documented somewhere.[/quote] Yea, I agree, best way to learn, imo, is to read a lot and ofcourse to use it… you should mess around with c++ a while, and you’ll see it’s not that hard…

Read full topic

item.title: Decompile .exe, is it possible?
item.dc:creator: @nade nade
item.description:
@nade wrote:

Why don’t you read a book? Everything that can be made in c++ is probably documented somewhere.

Read full topic

item.title: Decompile .exe, is it possible?
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Well just try making one with C or C++, or any other language. You can’t always trust people on Google. And if you actually find the source code for a compiler, study it a lot and then try to reverse the effects you’d think would make a compiler. I almost have no idea what the hell I’m talking about.

Read full topic

item.title: Decompile .exe, is it possible?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

sparkz:

No, it’s impossible to retain the C++ source code. Best he can do is disassemble it and mess around with the assembly.

I see, perhaps my views on things were unclear.

Read full topic

item.title: Decompile .exe, is it possible?

item.description:
@sparkz wrote:

No, it’s impossible to retain the C++ source code. Best he can do is disassemble it and mess around with the assembly.

item.title: Decompile .exe, is it possible?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

I believe it is possible to do so, but unless you want to waste years at a simple game that a simple rock throw away at google and a simple query for open source games for learning would be much more convenient.

Read full topic

item.title: Decompile .exe, is it possible?
item.dc:creator: @sparkz sparkz

@sparkz wrote:

No, best you can do is play with asm.

item.title: Decompile .exe, is it possible?
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

Hello, I’ve started to read some C++ guides and have searched for small games etc. which I could learn from if I had the source code, but none of the games come with the source code so I would need to decompile them. I googled this, but all I found was that compiled C++ is impossible to decompile because the compiling process has nothing to do with the language but I still keep trying. If anyone has any ideas how to decompile them, help would be very much appreciated.
